reviews.review_msg: Endre is a good prof and connects a lot of the material regarding other courses that he teaches. But his teaching is so dry. Easy course though if you get what he is saying!

slides were too long and repetitive but his teaching style is nice. Tries to engage with students. Assignments are easy as long as you have an idea of what he's talking about, use examples from his slides. 5 quizzes with unlimited retakes, but only for once a week. Writing assignments are simple and straightforward and can be done maybe 30 minutes.

This class was nice and chill, very easy to follow along. I would recommend keeping up with the readings as they help cement the concepts in your mind, but everything you are tested on is in the lectures. 50% of your grade is based on 5 in class quizzes that have retake opportunities, and half of the 20% final was made of recycled quiz questions.
Oh this class was so boring, i had to grab a coffee every time I went to his class.

I re-took this course a year later with Meg Grant. So many things Endre taught were incorrect and the course was completely different. Endre teaches hardly anything compared to other professors and is so boring. Wait for anybody else to take this course with. Endre seems alright until you take the course with someone who actually knows the content.

Very nice prof, I like him as a person. Slides are disorganized and unnecessarily long. Kind of boring, I find it hard to pay attention to him. Quizzes are unlimited repeats and barely change each time so it's nice. Easy to do good on assignments as long as you know what you need to do.
His classes are fun and he's very charming! Everything you need is in the slides (and there aren't even that many of them)! Take his class.

Endre's class is pretty easy because 50% of your grade is made up of quizzes that you get multiple retakes on, it's also worth noting that most of the times the quizzes are barely even changed. I also noticed he recycled some quiz questions in the final so if you are able know all the right answers for the quiz you should have an easy enough time.

The best prof for COGS 100, his lectures are very important and always engaged the entire class. He knows his stuff and poses very important topics that require a lot of thought. The final was very doable and his assignments were also very helpful in understanding important topics needed for the weekly quizzes and final. Take him if you can!!!

He's such a chill prof. Lectures are pretty interesting and easy to follow along. It has everything you need. The topics can be very abstract at times but the class gets better as you progress. Grades were very fair with final, quizzes (retries allowed) and writing assignments that aren't too bad if you go to lecture. Readings are very long.

AMAZING prof! He cares a lot about the class, knows the material very well, and has formatted this course in a great manner. In-class quizzes make up 50 percent of the course but he lets you re-do them, assignments are very straightforward and he helps explain concepts very well! He may very well be the best prof I have had in a really long time!

One of the best classes I've taken at SFU and all credit goes to Dr. Begby for that. Engaging lectures and really interesting content. Super accommodating prof who genuinely cares about his students. He also has a great sense of humor. Definitely recommend taking this class with Begby!

If this wasn't my last semester I definitely would've dropped the class the first week of lectures because the content just seemed SO confusing and I had no idea what was going on, but I swear it starts making sense and is so interesting too! Great prof, very organized & loved the structure of the class

Endre is funny, kind and approachable. Everything you need to know is on his slides and his presentations are concise.

There are 5 quizzes worth 10% each that you can retake multiple times, there are 5 writings worth 6% and there's a final worth 20%. Super easy to do well and enjoy this course with this grading scheme and his awesome teaching!

Dr. Begby is awesome. Cognitive Science can be overwhelming when you're first introduced to it but he explains concepts so clearly that you end up learning it way better than you thought you did! He's also hilarious, super helpful in office hours, and overall a great prof!! This course was super interesting too, cannot recommend more!

TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM IF YOU CAN! Dr. Begby is a great prof. He really wants you to know the course info and if you listen to him, you will learn. Aside from being a cool dude, he is also super knowledgeable in philosophy and cognition. Although because he's super knowledgable sometimes you feel stupid when you ask him a question. He's cool though.

Easily my favourite prof at SFU. He's super kind, approachable and willing to accommodate to students' needs. Puts a lot of effort into making lectures interesting and gives you lots of chances to gain points for participation (e.g. discussion board and live lectures). All the marking is done by the TA, but Endre still helps if you need it. 10/10.

Great prof! He cares about his students and is very accommodating during the time of online learning. The course isn't tough, a lot of material to learn but if you listen in the lectures you should be fine. There are quizzes every other week or so that are worth 10% each, but he allows you to have retake opportunities which is nice.

What a nice prof! He really cares about the class and the learning experience. He encourages questions and discussions during class which is really cool. I didn't really ask questions myself or comment but it was fun to see what my classmates had to say. My only complaint is that he was a bit monotonous sometimes so it was hard to keep focused.
